body:
Hello, as you might have noticed, we now have support rooms on TeamSpeak.


These rooms are like a Help-Desk. If you have any questions and/or concerns, you will move in here. A Moderator will then come and help you to the best of their ability. If you abuse these rooms, you will be banned from TeamSpeak. Please only come here if you need anything. It is not a place to talk to other players. If you have any questions and/or concerns, feel free to ask below. I will do my best to answer them. Have a great day :).

Just a note; this isn't for your life problems. Purely Avicus related.
body_tagged:

replies.body:
Regarding regular users abusing it: It'll be monitored, and they'll be dealt with appropriately.

Regarding staff abusing it: Not every staff member would abuse it. Like with a regular player, either notify another staff member, or "report" them. They'll be dealt with accordingly. 

Sure, one of the 2 will eventually happen, but that's why we have the Report subforum, and staff members. No matter what, the Support rooms are great, and were needed.

replies.body:
In reference to Greg, Zoom, and Emerald, I didn't mess with any ranks. Someone decided to mess with the retired rank and try to change the permissions (still not fixed). Also, I have no access to permissions in TeamSpeak. The only thing I have is access to all channels, and I really don't know why I still have that. 
I know how to fix the ranks, but obviously no one has asked me to fix it.

Note: I heard what happened to the TeamSpeak, anyone who said that it was my fault or that I caused is has some serious mental issues. I haven't had access to really any permissions in a while, and now is the first time that Ive heard of this issue.

Not everyone, maybe, anyday of this year or week or day,etc, a new user that joined TS will see Gill in a room with his rank so he will probably ask you or another mod: "What does the retired rank stands for?" and then you'll just answer him with what Gill did for this server and all the effort he putted on it.
It's not for the permissions the rank gives you, it's for the value it has.
